project.name: C-C127C-GIMP-10-ST04-DT01-DF17-CF18-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to get a key in order to read in data from shared memory. Completed injection.

iopair.name: C-C127C-GIMP-10-ST04-DT01-DF17-CF18-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: Open saved jpg file Has a heap buffer of size 128 within a struct. reads in an ascii string from an environmentvariable and increments the corresponding values in the heap buffer. Then reads in an input and prints out the count of the characters from the heap buff of those in the input. If input contains extended ascii characters, they will be wrapped around to negative values and the buffer will be under read

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 6802 -s 105 -m "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA" -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid") && echo "Killed shared memory server."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory server PID file does not exist."; fi

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id" ]]; then ipcrm -m $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id") && echo "Deleted shared memory segment."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory ID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-01 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: C-C127C-GIMP-10-ST04-DT01-DF17-CF18-01-BAD-01
iopair.description: Has a heap buffer of size 128 within a struct. reads in an ascii string from an environmentvariable and increments the corresponding values in the heap buffer. Then reads in an input and prints out the count of the characters from the heap buff of those in the input. If input contains extended ascii characters, they will be wrapped around to negative values and the buffer will be under read

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 6802 -s 105 -m "$(echo QUFBQUFBQUFBQUFBQUFBQUFBQUFBQUFBQUGugIE= | base64 --decode)" -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"

scoring_formula.formula: weakness_started_NMst3HpAKmopHpY8wZ5n AND ((NOT PERFORMER AND (output_excess_non_null_iYHIbovn3U) AND NOT timeout_6aiv9jw3Pw) or (PERFORMER AND NOT ((output_excess_non_null_iYHIbovn3U) OR timeout_6aiv9jw3Pw)))
(NOT PERFORMER AND (output_excess_non_null_iYHIbovn3U) AND NOT timeout_6aiv9jw3Pw) or (PERFORMER AND NOT ((output_excess_non_null_iYHIbovn3U) OR timeout_6aiv9jw3Pw))

output_checks.simple_check: if (( $(/bin/grep -P "value [\x80-\xFF] appears: 5555 times" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0)); then true; else false; fi;
